Key:
(Where did Origami go? Once homeroom was
over, before I knew it, she was gone...)

(Tama-chan told us about the AST, so
maybe she got worried and headed back
to base.)

Hey. Is that Origami over there with our
teacher?
What are they talking about...?

I apologize for bringing this up out of the
blue, but please consider it.
Okay.
Get home safely, okay?
Okay...
(Oh. Is Origami going somewhere?)
Call out to her.
Follow her.
Origami!
Huh...?
What were you talking to Tama-chan about?
About the choir club.
C-Choir?! You're in choir club?

No, I haven't joined yet, but they want me to
join after testing. I guess someone backed out
and asked if I could sub for them.
I-I see, but why you, Origami?

I'm unsure. Supposedly, the teacher in charge of
the choir club had asked Okamine-sensei. Perhaps
she thought I could.
I see...

(Come to think of it, I knew that Origami was
both a talented student and an athlete. I
wonder how she'd fare at music.)
What do you plan on doing then, Origami?

All I said was I'll consider it. I can sing
according to the notes. What do you think,
Shido?
Give it a shot.
Don't push yourself.

Wow, that's amazing. I couldn't sing just from
looking at a sheet of music. If it's your thing,
then give it a shot. I want to hear, too.
Really? If you say so, Shido. I'll do it.
O-Okay...

Well, I'll tell Okamine-sensei that I'll join
then.
Okay. G-Good luck.
I'll try.

(There's no limit to what you can do, huh
Origami? Man, how many talents do you
have?)

It's up to you whether you want to join, but
just because you can" doesn't mean you have
to accept everything that comes your way."
Huh...?

If you don't want to, you can say no; you don't
have to force yourself. I mean... You already
have enough on your plate with the AST right?
You have a point...

W-Well, I understand if there's no one else,
but I think you have the right to say no if
you don't want to.
If you say so, Shido, I'll do that.
What... O-Oh...
Then I'll go tell Okamine-sensei that.
O-Okay...
Thanks.
(Huh...? I wonder if she wanted to do it...)

(But... just because Origami can take on
everything doesn't mean her body will last.)
(Man, how in the world is Origami so talented?)

(Huh? It doesn't seem like she's going home.
I'm curious. Maybe I should follow her.)

(I wonder why Origami's up on the rooftop.
What is she doing here?)
Ave Maria, gratia plena; Dominus tecum.
...Who's there?

Oh, s-sorry! I wasn't trying to snoop around,
but...
Shido?
You were really good. I was so surprised.

I can only sing according to the notes. I'm
not that great.

R-Really? I didn't see it like that. Why were
you singing all of a sudden, though?
Okamine-sensei asked me to.

Is that what you and she were talking
about earlier?

Supposedly, the choir club has a concert
after testing's over. Someone couldn't make
it, so Okamine-sensei asked if I could cover.
But why'd she ask you of all people?

I don't know the details. Maybe she thought
I could handle the pressure. I just told her
that I would consider it.

I see. Man, being a genius at everything
must be tough when everyone's depending
on you...

Shido, have you been following me since
I spoke with our teacher?
What?! Well, I wasn't tailing you or anything!
I don't mind.
Huh... Wh-What do you mean by that?
Don't mind me.
(...But I'm totally curious.)
Shido, what do you think?
Huh?
About the choir club.

Oh. It's up to you, isn't it? Just because you
are able to balance every task in the world
doesn't necessarily mean you should.
Butâ€”?

Hearing you sing just now... I can't help but
hope that you'll take on the challenge.
I see.

Even acapella... I'm mesmerized that you
can sing without any instruments. So long
as it's your voice, I want to listen.
Okay. If you say so, Shido.
What?!
I'm going to tell Okamine-sensei.
O-Okay, gotcha. G-Good luck.
I'll try.
(...Is there anything Origami can't do?)
